header.title: Authentication
header.content:
Authentication

UI Flow

Initial authentication must always first be performed with a successful POST of the username & password to the /login endpoint.

This is most commonly done via the UI.

Once logged in, from the User's Profile Page, a new API token can be created. Please note that the token will only be shown once. If you lose the token, you should delete it from your token list and generate a new token.

Programatic Flow

Once an API token has been obtained, scripted calls to the API can be made by using the Bearer Authentication. This header must be included with all calls to the API.

Note: Basic authentication (username, password) is not supported by any API endpoint other than initial login. A valid API token must generated for programatic access

Example

Authorization: Bearer

Javascript Fetch Example

fetch('https://batch.openaddresses.io/api/data', {
    method: 'GET',
    withCredentials: true,
    credentials: 'include',
    headers: {
        'Authorization': 'oa.1234-your-token-here-5678',
        'Content-Type': 'application/json'
    }
});
